meanings.definition: To work, write, or study laboriously, especially at night.
meanings.sent1: She was lucubrating on her thesis until the early hours of the morning.
meanings.sent2: The author spent countless nights lucubrating on his latest novel.
meanings.sent3: After lucubrating for hours, she finally understood the complex math problem.
meanings.sent4: His mind was lucubrating like a well-oiled machine, generating idea after idea.
meanings.sent5: The image of her lucubrating under the dim light of the lamp was etched in his memory.

meanings.sent1: The professor was lucubrating on a groundbreaking research paper.
meanings.sent2: Many renowned scholars lucubrate throughout their careers to contribute to their fields.
meanings.sent3: The students joked that their teacher must be lucubrating a masterpiece in his office.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was lucubrating with innovative theories that challenged existing beliefs.
meanings.sent5: The library was filled with the sound of pages turning as students lucubrated for their exams.
